BeginScale(ref Rect, Vector2, Single, Boolean)

Begins a scaled local area. Returns vector to offset GUI controls with to account for zooming to the pivot. Using adjustGUILayout does that automatically for GUILayout rects. Theoretically can be nested!

Declaration
public static Vector2 BeginScale(ref Rect rect, Vector2 zoomPivot, float zoom, bool adjustGUILayout)

GUIToScaledSpace(Rect)

Transforms the rect to the new space aquired with BeginNoClip or MoveClipsUp. DOES NOT scale the rect, only offsets it! It's way faster to call GUIToScreenSpace before modifying the space though!

Declaration
public static Rect GUIToScaledSpace(Rect guiRect)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Rect guiRect
Returns
Type Description
UnityEngine.Rect
| Improve this Doc View Source

GUIToScaledSpace(Vector2)

Transforms the position to the new space aquired with BeginNoClip or MoveClipsUp It's way faster to call GUIToScreenSpace before modifying the space though!

Declaration
public static Vector2 GUIToScaledSpace(Vector2 guiPosition)

Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Vector2 guiPosition
Returns
Type Description
UnityEngine.Vector2
| Improve this Doc View Source

GUIToScreenSpace(Rect)

Transforms the rect to screen space. You can use GUIToScaledSpace when you want to transform an old rect to the new space aquired with BeginNoClip or MoveClipsUp (slower, try to call this function before any of these two)! ATTENTION: This does not work well when any of the top groups is negative, means extends to the top or left of the screen. You may consider to use GUIToScaledSpace then, if possible!

Declaration
public static Rect GUIToScreenSpace(Rect guiRect)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Rect guiRect
Returns
Type Description
UnityEngine.Rect
| Improve this Doc View Source

GUIToScreenSpace(Vector2)

Transforms the position to screen space. You can use GUIToScaledSpace when you want to transform an old rect to the new space aquired with BeginNoClip or MoveClipsUp (slower, try to call this function before any of these two)! ATTENTION: This does not work well when any of the top groups is negative, means extends to the top or left of the screen. You may consider to use GUIToScaledSpace then, if possible!

MoveClipsUp(Int32)

Begins a field without the last count groups. They should be restored using RestoreClips. Can be nested!
